sentence.Network_en: You'll have four months in which to lick the recruits into shape.

sentence.Network_en: My room needed a lick of paint to freshen it up.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的房间只要刷一点油漆就能焕然一新。

sentence.Network_en: He might be able to lick us all in a fair fight.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果公平较量，他也许能将我们所有人都轻易打败。

jx.jx_en_mean: be excessively obsequious towards someone, especially to gain favour from them
look forward to something with eager anticipation

lj.lj_ly: the political organization he worked for was licking its wounds after electoral defeat.
lj.lj_ls: 他所在的政治组织在竞选失利后正在休养生息，以图恢复元气。

jx.jx_en_mean: A superficial effort made without care or enthusiasm.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 草率的努力：草率地或毫无热情地做出的表面上的努力

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring into satisfactory condition or appearance.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使成形，使象样：把某物整理好或使某物外形美观

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English liccian, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch likken and German lecken, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek leikhein and Latin lingere

entry.def: When people or animals lick something, they move their tongue across its surface.

example.ex: She folded up her letter, licking the envelope flap with relish...
example.tran: 她把信折好，用力舔了舔信封的折口。

example.ex: The dog rose awkwardly to his feet and licked the man's  hand excitedly.
example.tran: 那只狗笨拙地站起来，兴奋地舔着那个男人的手。

entry.def: If you lick someone or something, you easily defeat them in a fight or competition.

example.ex: He might be able to lick us all in a fair fight...
example.tran: 如果公平较量，他也许能将我们所有人都轻易打败。

example.ex: The Chancellor's upbeat message that the Government had licked inflation for good was marred by more job losses.
example.tran: 总理乐观地声称政府已经一劳永逸地解决了通货膨胀问题，但更多人的失业却令这一消息大为减色。

entry.def: When flames of a large fire lick somewhere or something, the fire begins to reach that place or thing and the flames touch it lightly and briefly.

example.ex: The fire came roaring through the kitchen ceiling and sent its red tongues licking into the entrance hall...
example.tran: 大火蔓烧过厨房的天花板咆哮而来，红色的火舌朝门厅内卷去。

example.ex: The apex of the flames licked the crimson sky.
example.tran: 火焰的舌尖舔卷着绯红色的天空。

entry.def: A lick of something is a small amount of it.

example.ex: It could do with a lick of paint to brighten up its premises.
example.tran: 可用少量油彩使四下显得更亮堂。

entry.tran: 小过门（吉他演奏的歌曲）；（即兴插入的）爵士乐装饰乐句
entry.def: A lick is a short piece of music which is part of a song and is played on a guitar. A lick is also a short section in a piece of jazz, which the musician invents while they are playing.

example.ex: ...the screeching licks of heavy metal guitar.
example.tran: 用重金属吉他演奏的尖厉过门

means.word_mean: 1. a salt deposit that animals regularly lick

sentences.sentence: "the dog's laps were warm and wet"
"I gave him a clout on his nose"

means.word_mean: 1. beat thoroughly in a competition or fight;

sentences.sentence: "We licked the other team on Sunday!"

means.word_mean: 3. find the solution to (a problem or question) or understand the meaning of;

sentences.sentence: "Work out your problems with the boss"
"this unpleasant situation isn't going to work itself out"
"He could not work the math problem"
"the cub licked the milk from its mother's breast"

example.en: He was donkey-licked 2 to 1 by John Wilson.
example.zh: 他被约翰·威尔逊以二比一的票数彻底击败。

auth_sentence.content: He can still lick anybody else in the world.
auth_sentence.res_content: He can still lick anybody else in the world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He can still lick anybody else in the world.

sentences.en: The little boy is licking the ice-cream cone.
sentences.cn: 小男孩在舔着冰淇淋蛋卷。

sentences.en: I think we could lick the best teams there.
sentences.cn: 我想我们能打败那儿最好的队。

sentences.en: The flames licked against the building.
The flames of the fire licked the sides of the fireplace.
sentences.cn: 火焰卷烧着壁炉的边缘。

sentences.en: He gave the bowl a thorough lick.
sentences.cn: 他把饭碗舔得一干二净。

sentences.en: The house would look better with a lick of paint.
sentences.cn: 这房子稍加颜色就好看了。

jushi.english: He went off as hard as he could lick.
We've licked the team every time we've played against it.
jushi.chinese: 每次与该队交锋,我们都把它击败了。
